questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer must create an EEM script that saves a copy of the running configuration to bootflash and writes a message to syslog when a user saves the configuration to a Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch. Which command completes the configuration set?

choices.A: aaa authentication login console fallback error local
choices.D: aaa authentication login default fallback error local

discussion.content:
The solution should be: 
aaa authentication login default fallback error local
Because the fallback command is not available for "login console"

Selected Answer: A
A is correct for MDS9000 series

comments.content: A is Correct Answer, this for Nexus not MDS

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Correct Answer :

C

aaa authentication login default {group group-list [none] | local | none}

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/security/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Security_Configuration_Guide_chapter_0111.html

"fallback" command for disable local authentication
I'm just wondering why not C? Since local fallback is enabled by default.

questions.question_text: A network engineer must configure a Cisco MDS switch to use the local user database for console access if all AAA servers are unreachable. Which configuration should be applied to complete this task?

choices.A: Disable the Finance user account and add the authentication service for the Admin privileges.
choices.D: Delete the old locale Finance and remove the Finance department from the Finance locale.
choices.B: Create a new locale Admin and add the Admin department to the Admin locale.
choices.C: Create an Admin user account and remove the authentication service for the Finance privileges.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. To provide the new user with access privileges to the Admin department data and applications in the Cisco UCS Manager, the following set of changes must be implemented in Cisco UCS Central:

Create a new locale for the Admin department.
Add the Admin department to the new Admin locale.
Add the new user account to the Admin locale.
This will allow the new user to access the data and applications in the Admin department.

Selected Answer: B
B. Create a new locale Admin and add the Admin department to the Admin locale.


Here's why this is the correct approach:


Creating a new locale: A locale in Cisco UCS Central defines a set of privileges that are associated with specific resources, such as service profiles, organizations, or domains. By creating a new locale for the Admin department, you can specify the exact privileges that users in this locale should have.

Adding the Admin department to the Admin locale: Once the new locale is created, you can associate the Admin department with this locale, effectively granting users in this locale access to the resources and applications of the Admin department.

questions.question_text: A new user with access privileges in the Finance department moves to a new Admin department. The user must have access privileges to the Admin department data and applications inside the Cisco UCS Manager. Which set of changes must be implemented in Cisco UCS Central for the user to acquire the privileges?

An engineer configures a role for a new user in Cisco UCS Manager. The role should allow the user to configure vHBAs, vNICs, and server port types. Which role should be assigned to allow the engineer to complete this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Network Administrator
Read-and-write access to fabric interconnect infrastructure and network security operations. Read access to the remaining system.

Server Compute
Read and write access to most aspects of service profiles. However, the user cannot create, modify or delete vNICs or vHBAs.

Selected Answer: C
It's C, 100%. server-compute includes ls-server-policy, which do all required stuff. network admin can not create vHBA's. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/Reference-Docs/Privileges/4-2/b-UCSM-Privileges-4_2.pdf

comments.content:
i think you got it wrong there. Refer explanation below. Correct answer is Network Admin.

Network Administrator
Read-and-write access to fabric interconnect infrastructure and network security operations. Read access to the remaining system.

Server Compute
Read and write access to most aspects of service profiles. However, the user cannot create, modify or delete vNICs or vHBAs.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/unified_computing/ucs/ucs-manager/GUI-User-Guides/Admin-Management/3-1/b_Cisco_UCS_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_3_1/b_UCSM_Admin_Mgmt_Guide_chapter_01.html

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. To affirm the identity of the Cisco UCS Manager after a valid CA-signed keyring for HTTPS access is created, the engineer must create a trusted point.

When HTTPS is configured on the Cisco UCS Manager, the switch presents its SSL/TLS certificate to the connecting client. To ensure that the client trusts the certificate, a trusted point must be created on the client, pointing to the certificate in the keyring. The trusted point is configured with the certificate authority (CA) that signed the certificate, which allows the client to validate the certificate.

questions.question_text: An engineer must affirm the identity of the Cisco UCS Manager after a valid CA-signed keyring for HTTPS access is created. Which action completes the configuration?
